pull.title: Simplify ProcessGetBlockData execution by removing send flag
pull.body: Setting the send flag to false can be replaced by simply returning.

events.body: the send flag effectively exits the function whenever it's set to false, this simply actually returns
Yes, I can read the code. But can you actually put that in the PR description? The description goes into the merge commit for example, and is helpful for people investigating the history of code.

rename.to: Simplify ProcessGetBlockData execution by removing send flag

events.message: Functional test of receipt of invalid getdata request.

issue.title: Simplify ProcessGetBlockData execution by removing send flag
issue.body:
Rebased/nits fixed version of #13250.
> Setting the send flag to false can be replaced by simply returning.

events.body: I've rebased and fixed the nit in #13670.

comments.body: you should return if pindex is not defined

comments.diff_hunk:

+"""Request non-existent block.

+from test_framework.mininode import *
+from test_framework.test_framework import BitcoinTestFramework
+from test_framework.util import *
+
+# TestP2PConn: A peer we use to send messages to bitcoind, and store responses.
+class TestP2PConn(P2PInterface):
+    def __init__(self):
+        super().__init__()
+
+class InvalidGetDataTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
+    def set_test_params(self):
+        self.setup_clean_chain = True
+        self.num_nodes = 3
comments.body: Looks like you're using 2 nodes below, index 0 and 1, is that right?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,34 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2016-2018 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""Request non-existent block.
+"""
+
+from test_framework.mininode import *
+from test_framework.test_framework import BitcoinTestFramework
+from test_framework.util import *
+
+# TestP2PConn: A peer we use to send messages to bitcoind, and store responses.
+class TestP2PConn(P2PInterface):
+    def __init__(self):
+        super().__init__()
+
+class InvalidGetDataTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
+    def set_test_params(self):
+        self.setup_clean_chain = True
+        self.num_nodes = 1
+
+    def run_test(self):
+        # Setup the p2p connections and start up the network thread.
+        self.test_node = self.nodes[0].add_p2p_connection(TestP2PConn())
+
+        network_thread_start()
comments.body: nit: The thread is always running on master. Remove this line.
